body_html:
@juraj-bicikl : Could you elaborate a bit on your use of TF_OperationOutputType? Specifically, I'm wondering whether your use of the C API needs to care about reference types.

@alextp is in the process of changing how variables are used without references (using the DT_RESOURCE type) and perhaps it makes sense for TF_OperationOutputType to always return the type (so DT_DOUBLE and not DT_DOUBLE_REF) so that the notion of references remains internal to the runtime.
body_text:
@juraj-bicikl : Could you elaborate a bit on your use of TF_OperationOutputType? Specifically, I'm wondering whether your use of the C API needs to care about reference types.
@alextp is in the process of changing how variables are used without references (using the DT_RESOURCE type) and perhaps it makes sense for TF_OperationOutputType to always return the type (so DT_DOUBLE and not DT_DOUBLE_REF) so that the notion of references remains internal to the runtime.
body:
@juraj-bicikl : Could you elaborate a bit on your use of `TF_OperationOutputType`? Specifically, I'm wondering whether your use of the C API needs to care about reference types.

@alextp is in the process of changing how variables are used without references (using the `DT_RESOURCE` type) and perhaps it makes sense for `TF_OperationOutputType` to always return the type (so `DT_DOUBLE` and not `DT_DOUBLE_REF`) so that the notion of references remains internal to the runtime.
